bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Henrico County was an original shire formed in 1634.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Henrico County (Va.) plats and surveys, 1813-1842, include a plat and survey (1813) of Little Shadhole island in the James River; a plat and survey (1833) of 86 acres along Three Chopt Road done on behalf of George Franklin and his brother; two plats and surveys (1835, 1842) done on behalf of Edward Cox; plat and survey (1839) of Daniel P. Howle's farm along Three Chopt Road done behalf of Miles H. Gardner; a plat and survey (1840) of 80 acres done on behalf of Warner W. Guy; a plat and survey (1846) of 30 acres done on behalf of John F. Reeve; a plat and survey (1856) of 185 acres in the falls of the James River done on behalf of Charles. S. Morgan; a plat (1853) of John Jordan, Senior's property; plat (1858) of property near the city of Richmond sold for nonpayment of taxes; and a plat (1863) of the farm called Centre Plains that belonged to Thomas B. Carter.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals are located at the Henry E. Huntington Library, San Marino, California.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Henrico County land records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.

Henrico County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Henrico County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
